meanings.sent1: The sailors pulled on the dragropes to move the heavy cargo.
meanings.sent2: The workers used the dragropes to pull the boat to shore.
meanings.sent3: The dragropes were so long that they looked like giant snakes slithering across the deck.
meanings.sent4: The dragropes stretched out like spiderwebs, connecting the ship to the dock.
meanings.sent5: The dragropes were as thick as tree trunks, making it easy to drag the load.

meanings.definition: to pull or haul using ropes
meanings.sent1: The horses had to dragropes to move the fallen tree off the road.
meanings.sent2: She had to dragropes to lift the heavy box onto the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to dragropes their toys across the room instead of picking them up.
meanings.sent4: He felt like he had to dragropes the weight of the world on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The team had to dragropes the sled up the steep hill, panting with effort.
